args:
The Halidom's fall deals a heavy blow to morale
among the siblings, but they regroup, formulate
a strategy, and begin the fight to reclaim it.
All is well until Alberius uses their own plan
against them, placing them in checkmate.
(The mood in here is suffocating.\nI'd kill to be anywhere else...)
Thank goodness you're awake, Valyx!\nI was so worried when you lost\nconsciousness during our retreat.
We're in the wooded city of Rovetelle,\nsouth of the Halidom. They were kind\nenough to arrange a place for us to stay.
If there is a situation worse than ＂terrible,＂\nwe've somehow found ourselves in it.
After our withdraw, we received word\nthat the Halidom had fallen.
Alberius and his black mana fiends have\nseized the stronghold for their own.
That castle was cradle and crux of all our\nefforts, and seeing it stolen away so easily\nhas dealt a massive blow to morale.

And little wonder given the starkness of
our defeat. Our current prevailing mood
is best described as a mix of grief over the
Halidom and despair at our war prospects.
But I'm going to get the Halidom back,\nwhatever it takes; we need it if we're to\nhave any hopes of winning this fight!
That place is more than just a castle:\nit's our seat of hope and peace of mind.\nWe HAVE to get it back.
Fine speech, A+ effort, I especially liked\nthe little warble in your voice at the end.\nNow HOW do you plan to take it back?
I...don't exactly have a solid plan just yet.\nBut I need to make it clear to everyone\nthat I haven't given up!

*sigh* Well, there's no point in fighting
unless you can win, so don't expect me
to charge headlong into my demise just to
make you feel better.
Not true, Emile. Even if the odds are grim,\nwe must fight on.

A citizenry stripped of hope soon becomes
desperate, and such a kingdom is destined
to rot from within. We must show the
people that all is not lost.
It is our duty as royalty to protect the\npeople, and all the more so if the threat\ncomes from one who shares our blood.
Actually, I think Emile is raising an\nextremely reasonable point.
Embarking on a lost fight lacks elegance.
I've little concern for elegance, but Emile\nis correct to say there is no meaning in\nfighting a war one cannot win.
So you and Chelle think we should just...\nwhat? Give up?
Do not mistake me. I'm merely saying\nwe should not fight with the intention\nof losing in the end.
So if we're to fight, we do so under the\nassumption of victory?
Either we win or the future is lost.\nThis makes failure unacceptable.
Unless you all INTENDED to lose again?

...I will take your silence for consent.
In that case, let us begin formulating our
plan to grind that smug ersatz hero into
the mud beneath our boots.
It is good to see you up and about, Valyx.\nEmile was quite concerned for you.
I'm in sorry shape indeed if a brother\nlike him is worrying for me.
Are you harboring any doubts about\ntomorrow's operation?
We draw the enemy's attention while\n{player_name} strikes Alberius.\nA poetic bit of revenge for the Halidom.

And no, I have no doubts; we have
crafted contingencies for everything
from terrain to weather conditions,
down to the last detail.
Perhaps you hoped to be the one\nto face off against Alberius?
I acknowledge our brother's skill. He has\nthe blood, the strength, and the faith of the\npeople. He's a royal, through and through.
Ah, yes. Your three traits for a regent.\nI recall you speaking of them often\nwhen we were children.
I was bedridden with wyrmscale back then,\nso you and the others were my only link to\nthe world beyond my chamber door.

Days of cursing my fate, of fearing death...
And yet still I burned with a hunger for my
research—that which permitted me to
keep chasing faint hopes.

I've kept company with unrequited hunger
too long not to notice it in others, Brother.
You're biting your tongue about something,
so let's be out with it.
Perhaps you're right... But this is not\nthe moment for selfishness.
Our younger brother was chosen to fight\nAlberius with the blessing of us all.
Yes, but you have long silenced your own\nvoice in order to serve as an instrument in\nachieving others' designs.

Might it not be time to turn your eye from
the outward ideal you seek to uphold and
look inward? To reach out and grab hold
of what you truly hunger for?

...It's true. I do wish to face the hero I
admire above all others, and would do
anything to face him in honorable combat,
one warrior against another.
But enough of me, Phares. What of you?\nDo you still think yourself the cause\nof all this misery?
If so, I expect your desire to stop Alberius\nis even greater than mine. Am I mistaken?
No, I don't suppose you are.
Whatever you might say to me now, I have\nno intention of objecting to the plan.\nAs royalty, this is my only correct choice.
I hope you're certain, Valyx...\nand that you're right.
The next day\nNorth of the Halidom\nLeonidas's command center
Final preparations are complete, Your\nExcellency. We await your orders.
Then let the operation to retake the\nHalidom commence. Send up the flare!
West of the Halidom\nChelle's command center
That's the flare. Look alive, people,\nbecause it's ladies first! Eee hee hee!
South of the Halidom\nValyx's command center
There is the signal. All units, move out!
East of the Halidom\nEmile's command center
The first flare has been fired, but the plan\nis for us to move after the second one.\n...Er, right?
Correct. Chelle and Valyx should be\ncommencing their attack now.
Once the enemy mobilizes to meet them,\nthey'll fall back and draw their forces to\nthe Halidom's south and west.
And once our foe is stretched thin, we and\nLeonidas strike from the east and north.\nEr, but is this really going to work?
Obviously we can't expect everything\nto go exactly to plan, but—
Ah, there's the second flare. The initial\nstage of the plan has worked, at any rate.
In that case... Time to move out, you lot!\nSoldiers of Dyrenell, fall in behind me!
Alberius will surely realize that a\nsimultaneous strike from all directions\nis a feint...
But for that very reason, he'll likely be\nreluctant to make a move before he knows\nwhere the real attack is coming from.
Next up is {player_name}'s unit,\nbut...I remain concerned.
Hmm... Emile is leading his troops well.\nThis gives me an opportunity to head out\non an independent raid.
And if things have gone to plan, Alberius's\nforces should have been drawn out of the\nHalidom by now.
My friends dug these tunnels as a means\nof escape in emergencies—though I never\nthought I'd use them to get IN.
Their numbers inside the castle should be\nthin, but Alberius will still be here tracking\nthe status of the four fronts.
So we take him out here and now!
Alberius is not here, and there is no sign\nof black mana, fiends, or dragons either.
However successful our sibling's diversion,\nthere is no way EVERYONE would abandon\nthe castle and simply—
But how did they react to us so quickly?
They saw right through our strategy,\nwhich means Alberius is...
Did you really think to find me just\nsitting about the castle?
You're awfully impatient for a storied hero\nof legend. I didn't think you would take\nsuch obvious bait.
Waiting around was never my style.
Nor cleverness, apparently. Regardless,\nwe'll be taking the Halidom back now.

If you hope to provoke me and buy time,
you're going to be terrifically disappointed;
I can handle you lot and make it back
with time to spare.
Such self-flattery ill suits you...and yet I\nknow you're not just idle talk!
Dire news, sire! Lady Chelle and Leonidas\nare routed! Their forces are retreating!
And the Dyrenell Army under Emperor\nEmile is all but wiped out! At this rate,\nour own forces will soon fall!
Black mana-frenzied fiends and dragons\nare formidable, but it shouldn't be possible\nfor them to change the tides so quickly.
Draw my forces out in each direction then\nstrike me at the Halidom, was it? Ah, but\nI'm afraid your little plan missed the mark.
I expect you've already heard, but I've\ncrushed your other three siblings.\nSo then, warrior...what is your play?
I stand strong...and I will avenge the\nhumiliation I suffered at your hands!\nNOW FACE ME, VILLAIN!
